summary: Resolved 4 merge conflicts between feature/166-fileguard-sprint-2-issue-166 and origin/main. The core conflict was in document_extractor.py where both branches had fundamentally incompatible implementations: HEAD used ByteOffsetEntry/char offsets/_normalise/_build_byte_offsets; origin/main used OffsetEntry/text offsets/_normalize/_extract_sync with logging and context manager support. Chose origin/main's more complete implementation throughout for consistency.
strategyUsed: chose origin/main for all 4 files: (1) fileguard/core/__init__.py — used origin/main's more descriptive docstring; (2) docs/concepts/fileguard/README.md — used origin/main's more accurate rate_limit.py description and complete test directory structure (adds conftest.py, test_smoke.py, integration/ tests); (3) fileguard/core/document_extractor.py — used origin/main's implementation which adds logging, context manager support, _collect_strings for JSON, _extract_sync dispatcher, and _guess_mime_from_name; (4) tests/unit/test_document_extractor.py — used origin/main's test suite which is aligned with the chosen implementation (tests OffsetEntry, _normalize, _extract_sync directly rather than the HEAD ByteOffsetEntry/_normalise/_build_byte_offsets API)
